medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was well until 8 days before admission when she developed painful cramping in the lower abdomen and bloody diarrhea, with bowel movements approximately every hour, preventing sleep. Symptoms persisted despite ibuprofen. On the third day, she experienced two episodes of nonbloody, nonbilious vomiting. Diarrhea resolved after 3 days, but vomiting continued and abdominal pain localized to the epigastrium. On the eighth day, urine output decreased, prompting emergency evaluation.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of attention deficitâ€“hyperactivity disorder, anxiety, and labial adhesions. Previous episodes of dysuria, without evidence of urinary tract infection.
medical_history.family_history: Maternal grandfather had antiphospholipid syndrome, paternal grandmother had hypothyroidism, mother had gestational hypertension; no known family history of kidney disease or inflammatory bowel disease.
medical_history.social_history: Lives with parents and siblings. Recent travel to New York City with exposure to street food. Not sexually active, does not smoke, drink alcohol, or use illicit drugs.
